content: Anna Goldie and Azalia Mirhoseini developed AlphaChip at Google, which utilized AI to design four generations of TPUs and significantly reduced chip floor planning time from months to hours.
Chip design currently represents a critical bottleneck for AI progress, typically requiring years and hundreds of millions of dollars.
Ricursive Intelligence aims to enable an evolution in the chip industry from 'fabless' to 'designless,' allowing any company to create custom silicon.
Ricursive Intelligence envisions a future of recursive self-improvement where AI designs more powerful and faster chips, thereby accelerating AI itself.
